name: Devils' Playground
text: Create four 1/1 red Devil creature tokens. They have "When this creature dies, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor:
"The city is overrun. I would say burn it to the ground, but that won't be necessary."
—Inquisitor Delmund
On expeditions through Ashmouth, the hunters of Devilthorn Lodge rely on the cleverness of foxes to counteract the mischief of devils.

name: Devoted Caretaker
text: {W}, {T}: Target permanent you control gains protection from instant spells and from sorcery spells until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Her eyes blaze with the strength of twenty shields. Every glance is a salvation.

name: Devoted Druid
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Put a -1/-1 counter on Devoted Druid: Untap Devoted Druid.

editions.flavor: "Mana lurks in all things, even in the depths of one's own heart."
The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.
The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

name: Devoted Retainer
text: Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: Deep within Eiganjo Castle lay the Palace of Infinite Halls, a seemingly endless network of corridors once guarded by a seemingly endless legion of samurai.

name: Devour Flesh
text: Target player sacrifices a creature, then gains life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: His twisted mind concluded that if he was what he ate, and he wanted to stay human, . . .

name: Devour in Flames
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devour in Flames, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
Devour in Flames deals 5 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

editions.flavor: Ob Nixilis had prepared for every eventuality—except Chandra Nalaar.

name: Devouring Deep
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: "Full fathom five thy father lies;/ Of his bones are coral made;/ Those are pearls that were his eyes;/ Nothing of him that doth fade,/ But doth suffer a sea-change/ Into something rich and strange." —William Shakespeare, The Tempest

name: Devouring Greed
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devouring Greed, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target player loses 2 life plus 2 life for each Spirit sacrificed this way. You gain that much life.

name: Devouring Light
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: "Even your shadow is too foul to tolerate."
Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.

name: Devouring Rage
text:
As an additional cost to cast Devouring Rage, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. For each Spirit sacrificed this way, that creature gets an additional +3/+0 until end of turn.

name: Devouring Strossus
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Devouring Strossus.

name: Devouring Swarm
text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Devouring Swarm gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Their arrival is heralded by the deafening hum of ten thousand wings. Their departure is marked by the silence of the dead.

name: Devour in Shadow
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Devout Chaplain
text: {T}, Tap two untapped Humans you control: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "By Avacyn's decree, we shall cleanse these relics of their demonic past."

name: Devout Harpist
text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.

editions.flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.

name: Devout Invocation
text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying for each creature tapped this way.

editions.flavor: A prayer to bring demons to their knees.

name: Devout Lightcaster
text:
Protection from black
When Devout Lightcaster enters the battlefield, exile target black permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Goddess, grant us light to banish the world's shadows."
—Prayer to Kamsa

name: Devout Monk
text: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Discipline wears many robes.

name: Devout Witness
text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.
The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.

name: Dewdrop Spy
text:
Flash
Flying
When Dewdrop Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top card of target player's library.

editions.flavor: Only in dew from Oona herself is there clarity enough to see a victim's mind.

name: Dhund Operative
text: As long as you control an artifact, Dhund Operative gets +1/+0 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Baral's spies always have the latest technology.

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Target player sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Diabolic Machine
text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.

editions.flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning." —Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

text: Search your library for up to X cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"There are some secrets so dark no human mind should ever contain them. Interested?"
—Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis

text:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.
When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

name: Diabolic Tutor
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Diabolic Vision
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."

name: Diamond Faerie
text:
Flying
{1}{S}: Snow creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

editions.flavor:
"That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Diamond Faerie Avatar
text: {S}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: CSP Participation Avatar

text:
{3}, {T}: Create a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token.
Sacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications."
—Telim'Tor

name: Diamond Valley
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty
text: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Dichotomancy
text:
For each tapped nonland permanent target opponent controls, search that player's library for a card with the same name as that permanent and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Dictate of Erebos
text:
Flash
Whenever a creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: "I take no pleasure in your suffering, but it is necessary. Once you accept your fate you'll find eternity more tolerable."

name: Dictate of Heliod
text:
Flash
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"
—Polyxene the Doubter

text:
Flash
Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: "I refuse to let the folly of mortals endanger the home I made for them."

name: Dictate of Kruphix
text:
Flash
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.

editions.flavor: "Knowledge is cruel. It will break your heart and test your allegiances. Are you certain you want this curse?"

name: Dictate of the Twin Gods
text:
Flash
If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.

editions.flavor: Iroas and Mogis are as different in appearance as they are in personality.
Iroas and Mogis are as different in appearance as they are in personality.

name: Die Young
text: Choose target creature. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay any amount of {E}. The creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each {E} paid this way.

editions.flavor: "When the time comes, let go. Nothing lasts forever."

editions.flavor:

name: Diluvian Primordial
text:
Flying
When Diluvian Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, you may cast up to one target instant or sorcery card from that player's graveyard without paying its mana cost. If a card cast this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

name: Dimensional Breach
text: Exile all permanents. For as long as any of those cards remain exiled, at the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns one of the exiled cards he or she owns to the battlefield.

name: Diminish
text: Target creature has base power and toughness 1/1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

—Lewis Carroll, Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

name: Diminishing Returns
text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.

name: Dire Wolves
text: Dire Wolves has banding as long as you control a Plains. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group.
